subject: Law
title: Superfund: Cleaning Up the Past
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Superfund: Cleaning Up the Past.

hook.text: Love Canal was a neighborhood built on a toxic dump. Children got sick. The government created Superfund to fix it.

buildup.text: CERCLA (Superfund, 1980) makes responsible parties pay for cleaning up contaminated sites from past pollution.

discovery.text: Liability is strict, joint, and several: even one party can be held responsible for the entire cleanup cost.

twist.text: Cleanups can take decades and cost hundreds of millions. There are still over 1,300 sites on the national priority list.

climax.text: The 'polluter pays' principle drives Superfund. When polluters can't be found, taxpayers foot the bill.

punchline.text: Pollution is cheap to create. Cleaning it up costs a fortune.

quiz.question: What type of liability does Superfund impose?
